intro: Diastema ochroleucum, commonly known as the white-veined nettle, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many stinging plants. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with prominent white veins, and it produces small, greenish flowers in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs that can cause irritation upon contact.
